New Records: Aaron Judge hit his major league-leading 55th homer of the season
Key Match Events: Gleyber Torres and Jasson Domínguez also went deep
Tyler Soderstrom and Ryan Noda each had two-run doubles for the A’s
Giancarlo Stanton doubled in a run in the seventh
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams is not mentioned but the Yankees manager Aaron Boone said of what he expects the environment at Yankee Stadium to be like on Tuesday
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's performance and reminiscing on memories as both a player and a kid when he made a few trips to the Coliseum
A's manager Mark Kotsay said that Judge has his MVP vote and called the Yankees “one of the better teams we’ve run into”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The A’s, who will play in Sacramento next season ahead of a planned move to Las Vegas in 2028, have one more series left at the Coliseum against the Texas Rangers beginning on Tuesday
Oakland's Lawrence Butler went 0 for 5, ending his league-leading streak of reaching base safely at 27 straight games
Others: RHP Jake Cousins (right pec strain) was placed on the 15-day injured list
RHP Ross Stripling (lower back strain) threw a 30-pitch bullpen session
